ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed research and close reading writing skills.

My skills as a writer developed because of this course. My main takeaways from this course include: the importance of warrants, the strength of a strong counter-claim, organization strategies on the paragraph and essay level, the impact of one writing a scholarly piece to "continue the conversation" surrounding a topic.

I learned how to be a more effective writer. In addition, I learned to adopt a mindset that would allow me to stay motivated while doing an assignment. I believe this skill is super helpful in English and other classes.
I was able to learn more about the fundamentals of writing and be able to practice writing in fun setting.
Organizing writing, synthesizing ideas in sources, researching and finding effective sources, close reading of ideas, a clearer style of writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think it was an excellent course. I loved the amount of revision that was encouraged as well as the freedom of the assignments. More structured writing instruction would be a plus but its definitely not necessary. I loved the course as it was.
I loved how this course closed on a note of creativity, a chance for students to use what they learned in the course in an informal academic format.
This course was as awesome as can be during a pandemic. I believe that nothing could be done to improve this class.
I really enjoyed the small class size and my instructor. The only weakness I would say is that since it was online, my level of engagement was a bit lower.

Strengths: Very clear feedback given on assignments and office hours really help. Actual class time was used extremely well to polish and explore writing concepts and 

Weaknesses:

Strengths: the subject matter is really fascinating, Dr. Klemann makes the classroom environment lots of fun, a very well organized course in terms of workload and deadlines, incredibly clear feedback. Really no weaknesses!

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Required virtual office hours as well as an incredibly detailed syllabus were very helpful strategies. The office hours helped me develop a relationship with the professor and the syllabus helped me to keep on track by showing me what was expected.

This course included opportunities for students to engage with one another outside of class. In a COVID-19 semester, it is very difficult to make connections with other students from one's classes. This class offered students an opportunity to cross this barrier and really get to meet (virtually) one another.

I think that this course excelled at adapting to the pandemic. For example, there was a pop up book activity we had to do, and Dr.Klemann emailed the materials to us. This class was as great as could be.

Zoom was fully and effectively utilized so that students could interact with each other in the virtual seminar. Breakout rooms were also utilized. Not much could be improved as the use of Zoom achieved the goals of the format!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would recommend this course to another student because of the level of student engagement involved in this course. Students have multiple opportunities to confront the class material and the class environment from different angles. The combination of a course blog, in-class discussion, and class visitors made this class thoroughly engaging.
Definitely. Dr. Klemann is an amazing professor. She is super motivated and cares for her students.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Its super fun and really helpful.

Yes! Aside from being just a generally amazing time, this course really helps improve writing, especially with Dr. Klemann's clear and pointed feedback. Definitely check it out for a strong writing exercise to improve your life as a writer!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: virtual seminar
